intro: Sagenia calcarea, commonly known as the limestone sage, is a flowering plant native to rocky, calcareous soils in the Mediterranean region. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny environments and is adapted to withstand harsh, arid conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an important species in its native habitat. Sagenia calcarea is also valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
